summary: Build a brand-new simple, cute, proposal-themed single-page website dedicated to Ahana, as a message from Suvo to Ahana, incorporating the user’s uploaded photos (select the best 2 similar photos to use).
architectural_notes: Personalization detail: the Valentine website content should present the message as coming from the user named “Suvo” to his girlfriend “Ahana”. तप
Tone update: include a proposal angle with a mix of cute, funny, dramatic, and romantic content while keeping user-facing text in English and clearly from Suvo to Ahana.
Scope decision: user explicitly wants a NEW site (fresh design/content) rather than modifying the existing Ahana–Suvo proposal page.
Scope refinement: user wants a brand-new simple/cute (more minimal) proposal site, not a more elaborate multi-step interaction-heavy version.
Asset decision: use the user-uploaded photos on the page; choose the best 2 photos since some are similar.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, single-page Valentine website dedicated to the name “Ahana”, with all user-facing text in English and a romantic tone.

Implement a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a Valentine/love-letter aesthetic, applied consistently across the page (avoid a blue/purple primary palette).

Add core sections to the page: (1) Hero banner, (2) Short love note/letter, (3) “Reasons I love you” list (static), and (4) A closing call-to-action section such as “Will you be my Valentine?” with simple on-page interaction (no authentication).

Add lightweight decorative animations suitable for the theme (e.g., floating hearts or subtle sparkles) that respect performance and accessibility (provide a way to reduce motion if the user prefers reduced motion).
Add required static image assets to the project and render them on the page from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).

Personalize the existing Ahana Valentine single-page site to clearly indicate it is from “Suvo” to “Ahana” by updating the on-page copy (e.g., hero subtitle/tagline and the love letter sign-off) to include the sender name “Suvo” while keeping all user-facing text in English and maintaining the cute/romantic tone.

Update the user-facing copy across the single-page site to shift the tone from purely Valentine/romantic to a “cute + funny + dramatic + heartfelt” proposal experience, while keeping it clearly addressed to Ahana and clearly from Suvo, and keeping all text in English.

Enhance the closing interaction into a “very special” mini proposal flow: keep a simple on-page interaction but add a short, playful multi-step sequence (e.g., a tiny 2–3 question mini-quiz or a dramatic “Are you sure?” beat) that ends in a celebratory “Yes” outcome message for Ahana.

Add a new “special surprise” section on the page with a simple reveal interaction (e.g., “Open the tiny envelope” / “Tap for a secret message”) that displays a short, funny-but-sweet hidden message from Suvo to Ahana once revealed.

Increase the “cute/funny” feel of the decorative effects by expanding the existing floating hearts treatment with small variations (e.g., mixed heart/sparkle particles and/or a brief confetti burst on the final “Yes”), while maintaining performance and reduced-motion accessibility.

Add and render new static image assets that support the “proposal” vibe (e.g., a cute ring icon and a small doodle-style accent illustration) from frontend/public/assets/generated, and incorporate them into the hero/CTA/surprise section without changing backend behavior.
Create a new single-page proposal experience for Ahana from Suvo (fresh layout and fresh copy), replacing the current Valentine page content while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Implement a new cohesive visual theme distinct from the current rose/pink Valentine aesthetic, while staying romantic, cute, and playful (avoid a blue/purple primary palette). Apply the theme consistently across sections (colors, typography, spacing, cards, buttons, and backgrounds).

Add a playful, multi-step proposal interaction at the end of the page (2–4 steps) that includes at least one humorous beat and ends in a celebratory “Yes” outcome addressed to Ahana and signed/attributed to Suvo.
Add a “special surprise” section with a simple reveal interaction (e.g., opening an envelope / tapping a secret) that shows a short hidden message from Suvo to Ahana when revealed.

Upgrade decorative effects to feel cuter/funnier than the current floating hearts by mixing multiple lightweight particles (e.g., hearts + sparkles) and add a brief confetti burst on the final successful “Yes”, while respecting reduced-motion accessibility.
Update the HTML document metadata (title and description) to match the new proposal site (Ahana + Suvo) rather than the current Valentine wording.
Add new generated static image assets (from frontend/public/assets/generated) to support the new proposal theme and render them in the new page (no backend image serving).

Replace the current proposal page UI with a brand-new, simple, cute single-page proposal experience addressed to “Ahana” and clearly from “Suvo”, with minimal sections (hero + short message + photos + proposal moment) and all user-facing text in English.

Incorporate the user’s uploaded photos into the new page by selecting the best 2 unique images from: IMG_3752.jpeg, IMG_3753.jpeg, IMG_3752-1.jpeg, IMG_3753-1.jpeg; add the chosen 2 as static frontend assets and render them on the page (e.g., one primary hero photo + one secondary photo section).

Implement a simple, cute proposal interaction at the end of the page (single-step or at most two steps) that culminates in a celebratory “Yes” outcome for Ahana, signed/attributed to Suvo, and optionally triggers a lightweight celebration effect that respects prefers-reduced-motion.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine website for girlfriend named “Ahana” (romantic themed, personalized).
Update the site tone/content to be a funny + cute + romantic proposal experience (mix of playful, dramatic, and heartfelt elements) from Suvo to Ahana.
Create a brand-new (from-scratch) special proposal website for Ahana from Suvo (not a modification of the existing site).
Incorporate the user’s uploaded couple photos into the new simple cute proposal site, selecting the best 2 from the provided similar images.
